channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. plans to cut ties with Boy Scouts. And, Comey and James' criminal cases dismissed
item.description: Documents show the U.S. Military plans to cut support to the Boy Scouts. And, a judge dismissed the indictments against former FBI Director James Comey and N.Y. Attorney General Letitia James.
item.content:encoded:
Documents show the U.S. Military plans to cut support to the Boy Scouts. And, a judge dismissed the indictments against former FBI Director James Comey and N.Y. Attorney General Letitia James.

(Image credit: Dia Dipasupil)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: 5 things to know about the new obesity pills that are on the way
item.description: Instead of struggling with weekly injections, patients may soon be able to swallow a daily pill to lose weight. Both the makers of Wegovy and Mounjaro are seeking FDA approval for tablets.
item.content:encoded:
Instead of struggling with weekly injections, patients may soon be able to swallow a daily pill to lose weight. Both the makers of Wegovy and Mounjaro are seeking FDA approval for tablets.

(Image credit: neirfy/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: A tradition for turkeys: Another presidential pardon
item.description: What is a presidential turkey pardon – and why is it happening again?
item.content:encoded:
What is a presidential turkey pardon – and why is it happening again?

(Image credit: ANDREW CABALLERO-REYNOLDS)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: 8 economic insights we're grateful for
item.description: For this Thanksgiving, Planet Money and The Indicator staffers offer economic insights they're grateful for.
item.content:encoded:
For this Thanksgiving, Planet Money and The Indicator staffers offer economic insights they're grateful for.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Russian attacks kill at least 6 in Ukraine as talks on peace plan continue
item.description: Russia launched attacks on Ukraine's capital with at least six people killed in strikes that hit city buildings and energy infrastructure. The attacks came during a renewed U.S. push to end the war.
item.content:encoded:
Russia launched attacks on Ukraine's capital with at least six people killed in strikes that hit city buildings and energy infrastructure. The attacks came during a renewed U.S. push to end the war.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Italy's Campi Flegrei supervolcano is stirring. Could this seismic giant soon erupt?
item.description: The volcano near Naples is shaking the ground in a way that scientists say it hasn't for centuries, posing risks for hundreds of thousands of people living in the 8-mile-wide crater left by past eruptions.
item.content:encoded:
The volcano near Naples is shaking the ground in a way that scientists say it hasn't for centuries, posing risks for hundreds of thousands of people living in the 8-mile-wide crater left by past eruptions.

(Image credit: Valerio Muscella for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: She couldn't pay it back — so she paid it forward
item.description: In the midst of a divorce, Jolena Rothweil asked to borrow some money from a friend. All he asked in return was that she pay it forward, and that act began a chain of kindness.
item.content:encoded:
In the midst of a divorce, Jolena Rothweil asked to borrow some money from a friend. All he asked in return was that she pay it forward, and that act began a chain of kindness.

(Image credit: Jolena Rothweil)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: New limits on school loans could narrow physician and nurse pipeline, educators warn
item.description: Under new Trump administration rules, students won't be able to borrow as much for medical or nursing school or some other health professions.
item.content:encoded:
Under new Trump administration rules, students won't be able to borrow as much for medical or nursing school or some other health professions.

(Image credit: Lori Van Buren/Albany Times Union/Hearst Newspapers)
item.dc:creator: Joanne Kenen

item.title: We're shopping our feelings this Black Friday. Here are 3 things to know
item.description: Signs are pointing to deeper discounts this Black Friday, as stores try to coax anxious shoppers into splurging.
item.content:encoded:
Signs are pointing to deeper discounts this Black Friday, as stores try to coax anxious shoppers into splurging.

(Image credit: Nate Smallwood)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: U.S. ready to cut support to Scouts, accusing them of attacking 'boy-friendly spaces'
item.description: Documents show the U.S. military is planning to sever all ties with the organization formerly known as the Boy Scouts.
item.content:encoded:
Documents show the U.S. military is planning to sever all ties with the organization formerly known as the Boy Scouts.

(Image credit: Ted S. Warren)
item.dc:creator: Graham Smith
